6.text: We use inverted commas (quotation marks) when we are quoting the exact words of a speaker or writer.
6.ssml: <speak><prosody rate='slow'>We <break time='200ms'/> use <break time='200ms'/> inverted <break time='200ms'/> commas <break time='200ms'/> (quotation <break time='200ms'/> marks) <break time='200ms'/> when <break time='200ms'/> we <break time='200ms'/> are <break time='200ms'/> quoting <break time='200ms'/> the <break time='200ms'/> exact <break time='200ms'/> words <break time='200ms'/> of <break time='200ms'/> a <break time='200ms'/> speaker <break time='200ms'/> or <break time='200ms'/> writer. <break time='200ms'/></prosody></speak>

9.text: Get into groups of five and relate some interesting stories. Now write out one of the stories. Use inverted commas when you write conversations of your story.
